I‚Äôm happy to share that I‚Äôm starting a new position as an IT Recruiter!

Apparently, you need to use some special resume template that beats ATS robots if you want recruiters to even consider your application. ü§îWrong! ü§¶‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è That's like saying all restaurants need to serve the same type of food in order to be successful. Just because you have a special template doesn't mean it's the only way to get noticed by recruiters and beat the¬†ATS robots.Here are the top 5 resume myths that candidates should know:‚ö†Ô∏è Myth 1: Your resume must be one page long.While it is generally recommended to keep your resume as concise as possible, there is no hard and fast rule that says it must be one page long. The length of your resume should be determined by the relevance and quality of your experiences and skills, rather than an arbitrary page limit.‚ö†Ô∏è Myth 2: You need a special resume template to beat ATS robots.While having an aesthetically-pleasing, well-formatted resume is important, there‚Äôs no special type of resume template that will get past an ATS robot. While it is true that certain formatting and layout choices can increase the chances of your resume being seen by a human recruiter, there is no foolproof way to beat ATS systems.Instead of focusing on finding a "magic" template, it is generally better to create a clear and concise resume that highlights your relevant skills and experiences. Resume templates that will beat ATS robots don't exist!‚ö†Ô∏è Myth 3: You need to use a resume scanner to get feedback on your resume's impact and ATS compliance.False. While resume scanners can be a helpful tool, they are not a substitute for a thorough review by a human recruiter or career professional. It is important to have your resume reviewed by someone who can provide personalized feedback and guidance on how to improve the content and formatting of your resume.‚ö†Ô∏è Myth 4: Your resume should include your entire work history.It is not necessary to include every job you've ever had on your resume. Instead, focus on including the most relevant and recent experiences that demonstrate your qualifications for the position you are applying for.‚ö†Ô∏è Myth 5: Hidden keywords in the resume will help you beat ATS robots.While it is important to include relevant keywords in your resume, trying to sneak in hidden keywords in an attempt to "beat" an ATS (applicant tracking system) is not a good strategy. This can come across as spammy and may actually hurt your chances of getting hired.üëâ Here's the bottom line: The best thing you can do with your resume is to keep it simple, clear, and concise. Focus on what matters ‚Äì your experience, skills, and accomplishments ‚Äì and make sure your language is professional but not overly formal. That way, you can be sure that your resume will stand out from the rest!Good luck, job seekers!¬†üöÄ#career #recruitment #resume

I‚Äôve had lots of questions about what we‚Äôre seeing at Deel in this job climate. How are employers reacting to today‚Äôs reality, and what does our data show? üßµüëÄDeel handles HR for global teams - onboarding, payments, and yes - even terminations. Here‚Äôs what‚Äôs trending across hundreds of thousands of workers in 100+ countries üåé1/ The debate around local vs. global pay is dead ‚ò†Ô∏è The balance of power has swung back to employers, and our data shows that the majority are practicing location-based compensation2/ Layoffs. Lots to unpack here.Engineers - more redundant in leaner times - made up 10% of all terminations handled by Deel in 2022. Customer support, data, and product groups saw an overall increase of terminations. 3/ Our data shows that the US, UK, and Canada were disproportionately impacted by layoffs.4/ The tech industry suffered the majority of terminations this year, followed by financial services, e-learning, and marketing/advertising. Real estate and media saw the largest % increase in terminations. 5/ It‚Äôs too early to tell how this climate will impact salaries long-term - they‚Äôre down <1% across all roles in 2022. But workers in some countries, like Colombia, Nigeria, and Spain, are seeing a larger-than-average reduction in salaries.6/ There are silver linings. Companies are becoming leaner overall, but hiring globally is significantly increasing. These hiring lanes from top-employing countries grew fastest: üá∫üá∏US hiring from üá¨üá™Georgia¬†¬†¬†üá¨üáßUK hiring from üáπüá∑ Turkey¬†¬†üá®üá¶Canada hiring from üáµüá∞Pakistan 7/ USD is a üîë attraction as budgets tighten. Given its strength, more contractors are opting to get paid in USD. In Q1, the % of global worker contracts in USD averaged 35% & jumped to 38% in Q2.8/ Remote is the ‚Äúit‚Äù work perk. üíÖIn 2022, 89% of Deel contracts were remote. A first for LinkedIn, 50% of all applications submitted in 2022 were for remote roles, but < 20% of all listed roles offer that flexibility!9/ Workers are more nomadic, moving for adventure, family and‚Ä¶tax incentives. üß≥Countries like Spain, Estonia & UAE are getting creative with visa schemes & e-residency programs to attract talent. I expect more gov'ts to follow. We're processing hundreds of visas per month.10/ My (biased) outlook? üîÆ¬†More orgs & workers will think global. Better HR tech makes it easier to reduce costs AND build strong culture across borders.¬†The world of work has changed. Dated systems won‚Äôt cut it.¬†2023: HR goes from cost center to competitive advantage. ‚ú®Fin

For this #WorldMentalHealthDay we want to express the importance of keeping a healthy, happy mind. Mental health problems affect us all, directly or indirectly ‚Äî so we all have a part to play in solving this issue. AppFollow takes the mental health of employees extremely seriously. We have always tried to maintain a healthy, open, and flexible workplace. Read about how AppFollow prioritises employee mental health here:

Hi everyone,I'm continuing my job search effort, and I'm asking you to support me by sharing info about me with anyone who may be interested in finding a software engineer to join their team.I have quite extensive experience in software development (10 years in the industry).I used to work on a desktop CAD software project (C#, C++, Autodesk AutoCAD API), computer hardware functional modeling project (C, DML, Python, Linux kernel and drivers), and participated in developing software for LTE base station (C++, Python).Tools and technologies I'm familiar with:- C++, C, C#, Python, Bash, Make, CMake, Bazel- Git, GitHub, Jenkins, Bitbucket, Jira, Scrum- computer architecture, networking (TCP/IP, RDMA)I'm looking for a job in hardware-related development, or in application development, or at entry-level backend development positions.I'm mostly interested in remote work opportunities at the moment.I would be grateful for you for sharing this info with anyone who may be interested.Thanks!#OpenToWork #C #Cpp #Csharp #Python #networking #software #development #job #team

Last three years while i was working at Supercede | The Reinsurance Platform are the greatest years in my career so far.But i decided to go in a slightly different direction and will see how it works. It was really hard to accept that direction, but tough times often requires tough decisions.I am very grateful for unique experience, connections with nice people from industry and really productive atmosphere which is possible only because this company is being lead by such a great founders as Jezen Thomas , Ben Rose  and Jerad Leigh ! You grew me up in different aspects. I also highly respect your patience during of that process.Thank you! One of the best teams I ever worked - pure true no doubts.If you are being hired by "Supercede" - be sure, these guys knows what they do. Highly professional people with unique culture making you productive every day -  great place to work and make reinsurance and world better!I hope I will get an another one chance to collaborate with "Supercede" again in future.
Riskbook has rebranded itself as Supercede to launch a data-driven global trading platform specifically created for the reinsurance sector.
